project1.title: Academic project
project1.description: Developed a nutritional tracking website with a PHP back-end using PDO, AJAX for smooth UX, and MVC architecture for organized code. The front-end was responsive and visually appealing, built with HTML, CSS, and Bootstrap. Worked within an Agile team for efficient development.

project2.title: Academic project
project2.description: Developed EDX (EDucation eXpert), an educational management platform using Next.js, TypeScript, Supabase, and PostgreSQL with Drizzle ORM. Features include course scheduling, real-time attendance tracking, and user management, with a responsive front-end styled in Tailwind CSS. Built using Agile and RAD methodologies and deployed on Vercel.

project3.title: Academic project
project3.description: Developed a healthcare platform enabling patients to search, rate, and comment on doctors, while doctors manage appointments and view feedback. Built with Angular for the front-end, NodeJS for the back-end, and MariaDB for data management, following Agile methodology for adaptability and continuous innovation.

project4.title: Academic project
project4.description: Developed a multidisciplinary project combining computer vision and augmented reality to visualize pulmonary infections. Using Python and OpenCV for image processing, infection zones in pulmonary scans were identified and modeled in 3D with Blender. These models were overlaid on real-world images using ARuco markers, with OpenGL handling real-time rendering for augmented reality visualization.
